text: Parmotrema austrocetratum is a species of lichen in the family Parmeliaceae. Found in Australia and New Zealand, it was described as new to science in 1988 by John Elix and Jen Johnston. The lichen, which can grow on either bark or rock, is light grey in colour, measures in diameter, and is loosely attached to its substrate. It is common on trees and rocks in coastal and hinterland areas along the subtropical and tropical east coast of Australia, as well as the North Island of New Zealand. Chemical analysis of the lichen revealed the presence of the secondary compounds atranorin and zeorin. ==See also== *List of Parmotrema species ==References== Category:Fungi described in 1988 Category:Fungi of Australia Category:Fungi of New Zealand austrocetratum
title: Parmotrema austrocetratum
